text.0: this i allow not in the earth or heaven at sacrifice or in these holy duties.
text.1: may the huge mountains crush him down degraded be atiyajas sacrificing patron.
text.2: or he who holds us in contempt o maruts or seeks to blame the prayer that we are making.
text.3: may agonies of burning be his portion may the sky scorch the man who hates devotion.
text.4: why then o soma do they call thee keeper of prayer why then our guardian from reproaches.
text.5: why then beholdest thou how men revile us cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion.
text.6: may mornings as they spring to life protect me and may the rivers as they swell preserve me.
text.7: my guardians be the firmlyseated mountains the fathers when i call on gods defend me.
text.8: through all our days may we be healthy minded and look upon the sun when he arises.
text.9: grant this the treasurelord of treasures coming observant oftenest of gods with succour.
text.10: most near most oft comes indra with protection and she sarasvatī who swells with rivers.
text.11: parjanya bringing health with herbs and agni well lauded swift to listen like a father.
text.12: hear this mine invocation come hither o universal gods.
text.13: be seated on this holy grass.
text.14: to him who comes to meet you gods with offerings bathed in holy oil.
text.15: approach ye one and all to him.
text.16: all sons of immortality shall listen to the songs we sing.
text.17: and be exceeding good to us.
text.18: may all the gods who strengthen law with Ṛtus listening to our call.
text.19: be pleased with theit appropriate draught.
text.20: may indra with the marut host with tvaṣṭar mitra aryaman.
text.21: accept the laud and these our gifts.
text.22: o agni priest as rules ordain offer this sacrifice of ours.
text.24: listen allgods to this mine invocation ye who inhabit heaven and airs midregions.
text.25: all ye o holy ones whose tongue is agni seated upon this sacred grass be joyful.
text.26: may the allgods who claim our worship hear my thought may the two worldhalves hear it and the waters child.
text.27: let me not utter words that ye may disregard closely allied with you may we rejoice in bliss.
text.28: and those who mighty with the wiles of serpents were born on earth in heaven where waters gather.
text.29: may they vouchsafe us life of full duration may the gods kindly give us nights and mornings.
text.30: at this my call o agni and parjanya help swift to hear my thought and our laudation.
text.31: one generates holy food the other offspring so grant us food enough with store of children.
text.32: when holy grass is strewn and fire enkindled with hymn and lowly homage i invite you.
text.33: allgods to day in this our great assembly rejoice ye holy in the gifts we offer.
